column4: hello! can anyone help? im using xp but have 2 partitions (c: and d:) d: is free so can i tell ubuntu to install on d: and still get dual boot with xp?
thanks chris. so i guess i can go ahead with the live cd and when the partitions page comes up i just select d:?
yes, dual boot with xp on C is easy
After you install Ubuntu on D... make a backup of your mbr for use later when you reinstall windows
